vocabulary.example: beauty rest [exp] - sleep that helps you look good
a wayfinder [n] - a good sailor, someone who navigates
muscle up [phv] - get ready, be strong
buttercup [n] - a nice name to call someone
a scavenger [n] - an animal that searches for food from garbage (rats, crabs, hyenas)
a collectible [n] - an item that people collect
cool [adj] - awesome, great
a realm [n] - an area, like a kingdom
a chicken [exp] - a coward
gimme [exp] - give it to me
That's a good one [exp] - That is a funny joke
get it [exp] - understand
How do I phrase this? [exp] - How do I say this?
sail [v] - travel on water using a boat
It makes sense [exp] - it is logical. It is clear
straight up [adj] - exactly
kooky-dooks [exp] - crazy, silly, weird
throw up [phv] - vomit
a human sacrifice [n] - killing a person in a ritual
kidding [v] - joking

questions.question: Maui thinks that Moana needs more sleep.
Maui tells Moana that she has become a real wayfinder.
Tamatoa stole Maui's hook from him.
Moana's people sent her on the journey to return the Heart of Te Fiti.
Lalotai is known as the Realm of Monsters.
Maui makes a joke about Moana being scared.
Maui wonders why the ocean didn't bring him his hook.
Maui asks Moana to sing a song.
The entrance to Lalotai only appears after a human sacrifice.
The entrance to Lalotai is not as far down as it seems.

grammar.explanation: Choose the word and place in the sentence that most logically connects the ideas in the sentence. Use words like: get, the, one, why, did, makes, for, it, up, lot, than, still. Some boxes will be empty.

exercises.sentence: A real wayfinder never sleeps, so they actually ___ where they need to go.
That was a good ___. How do you not ___ it?
I'm just trying to understand ___ your people decided to send you.
My people didn't send me. The ocean ___.
Why didn't ___ just take the Heart back to Te Fiti itself?
If you start singing, I'm going to throw ___.
It's a ___ farther down ___ it looks.

transcript.full:
Maui: (Did you) Enjoy your beauty rest? You know, a real wayfinder never sleeps, so they actually get where they need to go. Muscle up, buttercup. We're here.

Moana: You're sure this guy is going to have your hook?

Maui: Tamatoa? Oh, he'll have it. He's a scavenger. Collects stuff. Thinks it makes him look cool. And for Tamatoa, trust me, my hook is the coolest collectible.

Moana: And he lives up there?

Maui: No, no, no. That's just the entrance to Lalotai.

Moana: Lalotai? Realm of Monsters? We're going to the Realm of Monsters?

Maui: We? No. Me. You are going to stay here with the other chicken. That's what I'm talking about. Gimme some. Come on. That was a good one. How do you not get it? I called her a chicken. There's a chicken on the boat.

Maui: So, daughter of the chief, I thought you stayed in the village. You know, kissing babies and things. Hey, I'm just trying to understand why your people decided to send, how do I phrase this, you!

Moana: My people didn't send me. The ocean did.

Maui: The ocean? (That) Makes sense. You're what, eight? Can't sail. Obvious choice.

Moana: It chose me for a reason.

Maui: If the ocean is so smart, why didn't it just take the Heart back to Te Fiti itself? Or bring me my hook? The ocean is straight up kooky-dooks. But I'm sure it's not wrong about you. You're the Chosen One!

Moana: The ocean chose you for a reason.

Maui: If you start singing, I'm going to throw up.

Moana: So, (I'm) not seeing an entrance.

Maui: Yes, because it only appears after a human sacrifice. Kidding. So serious.

Maui: (Performs a short haka)

Maui: Don't worry. It's a lot farther down than it looks. Cheeeehoooo!

Maui: I am still falling!

Moana: You can do this. Go!
